inlineContent.text: If products aren‚Äôt showing up in TestFlight, check these common issues:
Complete all App Store Connect setup including
Verify products are properly linked to your TestFlight build
Use StoreKit Testing for more reliable purchase testing
When testing in-app purchases through TestFlight, there are several common pitfalls that can prevent your products from appearing properly. Here‚Äôs how to diagnose and fix them:
A common issue that‚Äôs not immediately obvious: You need to complete all App Store Connect setup sections before products will work in TestFlight, including:
(needs to be accepted)
Tax Information
Banking Information

Even for closed beta testing where no real transactions will occur, this information must be filled out. This requirement isn‚Äôt clearly documented by Apple but is essential for the StoreKit infrastructure to work properly in TestFlight builds.
Make sure that:
Your products are properly linked to your TestFlight build (see our
for detailed steps)
The FreemiumKit configuration file is included in your Asset Catalog
The bundle ID matches your App Store Connect configuration
TestFlight can sometimes behave unpredictably with purchases, such as:
Not reporting purchases properly to the app
Resetting purchase states unexpectedly
Showing inconsistent product availability

For more reliable testing, we strongly recommend using StoreKit Testing in Xcode. It provides a more accurate simulation of how purchases will behave in production. You can set up StoreKit Testing configuration files in Xcode and test purchases without needing App Store Connect approval.
If everything works properly with StoreKit Testing but not in TestFlight, it‚Äôs likely an App Store Connect configuration issue rather than a code problem.
If you see these symptoms:
Empty product list in TestFlight
Products visible locally but not in TestFlight
‚ÄúCannot connect to App Store‚Äù errors

First check the App Store Connect setup completion, particularly the Paid Apps Agreement, Tax, and Banking sections. These are the most common root causes of product visibility issues in TestFlight builds.
Have questions or need support? Reach out to me at
